explains: n. （数量的）激增，剧增；（细胞、组织、有机体的）繁殖，增生；大量
wordGroup: cell proliferation 细胞增殖，细胞增生
proliferation security initiative 防扩散安全倡议

sentences.en: Both countries are signatories to the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty.
sentences.cn: 两个国家都是《防止核扩散条约》的签约国。

sentences.en: Nuclear proliferation has returned to centre stage in international affairs.
sentences.cn: 核扩散又成了国际事务中的中心议题。

sentences.en: Scientists still don't know what triggers the proliferation of neurons in unilateral megalencephaly.
sentences.cn: 科学家仍然不知道是什么触发了单侧巨脑畸形神经元的增殖。
